title: How to Insert a Check Mark in Excel

steps.title: Click the cell into which you want to insert a checkmark.
steps.content: Click the cell into which you want to insert a checkmark. This highlights the cell.

steps.title: You can find it on the Insert toolbar.
steps.content: You can find it on the Insert toolbar. Here's how: Click the Insert tab at the top of Excel. Click the Symbols menu at the top-right corner. Click Symbol on the menu.

steps.title: Click the "Font" menu and select Wingdings.
steps.content: Click the "Font" menu and select Wingdings . This displays special characters you can insert into your spreadsheet. If you don't see this font, use Segoe UI Symbol instead. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Scroll through the characters and select the checkmark.
steps.content: Scroll through the characters and select the checkmark. Alternative, you can type 252 into the character code box (if using Wingdings) or 2714 (if using Segoe).

steps.title: You'll see the Insert button at the bottom of the window.
steps.content: You'll see the Insert button at the bottom of the window. This inserts the checkmark into the selected cell.
